SENT.plain: The authors report a case of recurrent cerebral embolism in a 43-year-old patient with a familial form of Rendu-Osler-Weber disease and review their experience of 19 cases of pulmonary arteriovenous fistula
Neurological complications were rare but considerably aggravated the disease
They were due to a significant right/left shunt but remained unpredictable, being unrelated to peripheral arterial saturation
The pathophysiological mechanisms and therapeutic possibilities are discussed
